result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin James Laduke #00616975 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.
2) If the defendant fails to satisfy these financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
JOC returned
Re-mailed to corrected address 7/18/22.
Transcript of sentencing hearing held April 11 2022

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin James Laduke appeared by video, in custody appearing from Stanley Correctional Institution.  Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Justin James Laduke.  Atty Kort updates the Court: e-filing the PLQ right now, ready to proceed to plea/sentencing.  State assures VR compliance, recites offer: plead to Ct 1, DRI Ct 2; joint rec for statutory court costs.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders a JOC; Count 2 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make a statement to the Court.  Court orders $443 costs. DNA to be provided to the BCSD.  Atty Kort to file a notice of appellate rights form.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin James Laduke
Current: Stanley Correctional Institution, 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 06-06-2022)
Prior: 7356 Fir St E, Webster, WI 54893
Sentencing hearing on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

8:59 AM Called 22CF06 for STC.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin James Laduke in court, in custody.   Attorney Russ S. Kort in court for Justin James Laduke. Judge John Anderson appeared by video into the Burnett County zoom conference room. All parties by zoom. Attny Kort updates the court, tentative agreement, may set for sentencing.  Would be a sentencing on misdemeanor.  Attorny needs to review PLQ with def, so ready within 10 days.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:00 PM Cases 21CF69, 21CF143, 22CF6 called together.  Defendant, Justin James Laduke, appeared with Attorney Russ S. Kort.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Justin James Laduke appeared by video means from Burnett County Public Access room with Attorney by video.  Case is on for Sentencing Hearing.  Parties acknowledge receipt of PSI, atty Kort notes corrections or modifications.  Parties waive in person hearing KIV.  Off the record 3:13 PM (audio lost), back on the record 3:15 PM, same appearances.  State argues for max recommendations of PSI.  Defense attorney argues for 1-2 years initial confinement, and 5 years extended supervision.  Atty Kort notes 3 character witnesses; court does not sequester.  First character witness "J.L." is sworn in and testifies.  ADA Schmidt does not cross.  Atty Kort calls second character witness "B.B." who is sworn in and testifies.  No cross from ADA Schmidt.  Atty Kort calls 3rd witness, "B.L." who is sworn in and testifies.  ADA Schmidt crosses.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders: 
21CF69
Count 1, Possess w/intent amphetamine- 2 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES
Count 2, Intimidate victim/threaten force, etc- 1 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES, concurrent to Count 1
21CF143
Count 1, Manufacture/deliver amphetamine- 2.5 yrs IC, 3.5 yrs ES concurrent with 21CF69
Conditions: undergo AODA and follow through. No abusive contact with the victim.  Complete moral recognition or cognitive behavior conditioning/programming- per DOC, absolute sobriety, no use/poss controlled subs without prescr and take only as prescribed, no association with people possessing or selling controlled substances (except for therapeutic setting), statutory court costs on each count.  Def to be remanded into custody today.  Eligible for SAP and CIP programming.
In case 22CF6, which remains open, Atty Kort asks to DRI.  Atty Schmidt responds, requests status conference.  
WEDS to be prepared by clerk and provided to def.  Voting and firearms restrictions given.  Def to provide DNA prior to leaving the building.  
Appeal rights provided.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

08:49 AM Cases 21CF69, 21CF143, and 22CF6 called together. Defendant, Justin James Laduke, appeared with Attorney Russ S. Kort.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Justin James Laduke appeared by video means from Burnett County virtual courtroom with Attorney.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Atty Kort updates- needs adjourned init in 22CF6 (so set), has gotten atty Kort appointed on all cases.  Case 22CF6 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  WTLPH.  ADA Schmidt notes plea already entered, asks to set for SEH, believes 22CF6 can be resolved.  Parties concur, request 45-60 min sentencing. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

08:46 AM Called 22CF6 for INIT and 21CF143 and 21CF69 for STC.  Defendant, Justin James Laduke, appeared in person from Burnett County zoom room with Attorney Russ S. Kort by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State by video.  Judge Anderson appeared by video into Burnett County public access / zoom room.  Def sent in letter saying he is no longer eligible for PD on new 2022 case.  Attny Kort is not then the Attny officially on record on 22CF06, def will need to fill out court appointed attny forms.  Attny Kort confirms he will continue on as Attny for 2021 cases. Court reviews court appointed attny process.  Attny Kort would be able to be court appointed on one and PD's appointed on others.  Court adjourned INIT, Def to complete court appointed attny form today while here. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:45 am.
